guide.introduction:
This is a really fun project for anyone interested in electronics or music. Best of all, it's inexpensive, easy to solder, and lots of fun.

You can pick up a kit in the Maker Shed.

Make sure to watch my video demo and take a guess at what song I'm playing!
guide.introduction_rendered:
This is a really fun project for anyone interested in electronics or music. Best of all, it's inexpensive, easy to solder, and lots of fun.

You can pick up a kit in the Maker Shed.

Make sure to watch my video demo and take a guess at what song I'm playing!

Relevant parts
  • Solar-Powered Theremin (Heliophone) Kit
  • Make project tin
Tools
  • Craft knife
  • Rosin-core solder
  • Scissors
  • Soldering iron
  • Third-hand tool

lines.text: Check your kit against the parts list
lines.text_raw: Check your [http://www.makershed.com/ProductDetails.asp?ProductCode=MKCWR1|kit] against the parts list

lines.text: Remember to get a mint tin to house the electronics, or pick up a Make Projects tin.
lines.text_raw: Remember to get a mint tin to house the electronics, or pick up a [http://www.makershed.com/ProductDetails.asp?ProductCode=MSTIN1| Make Projects tin].

lines.text: The first step is to cut out the templates provided in the directions. I used the piece of cardboard that the solar panel was attached to for the Theremin's top.
lines.text_raw: The first step is to cut out the templates provided in the directions. I used the piece of cardboard that the solar panel was attached to for the Theremin's top.

lines.text: Tape the bottom template in the tin. This will stop any of the electrical components from shorting out if they happen to touch the tin.
lines.text_raw: Tape the bottom template in the tin. This will stop any of the electrical components from shorting out if they happen to touch the tin.

lines.text: Add the long cardboard strip around the interior edge of the tin.
lines.text_raw: Add the long cardboard strip around the interior edge of the tin.

lines.text: Solder the 3 transistors and the 22K resistor.
lines.text_raw: Solder the 3 transistors and the 22K resistor.

lines.text: Make sure you insert the transistors according to the diagram or it will not work.
lines.text_raw: Make sure you insert the transistors according to the diagram or it will not work.

lines.text: You need to connect the (2) supplied capacitors together prior to soldering them.
lines.text_raw: You need to connect the (2) supplied capacitors together prior to soldering them.

lines.text: Make sure you connect them with the (+) and (-) ends together. The arrows on the capacitors, which happen to point to the negative lead, should be pointing from right to left when looking at the board.
lines.text_raw: Make sure you connect them with the (+) and (-) ends together. The arrows on the capacitors, which happen to point to the negative lead, should be pointing from right to left when looking at the board.

lines.text: Solder the capacitors to the board.
lines.text_raw: Solder the capacitors to the board.

lines.text: Don't clip the leads yet! You can cut the (+) lead, but the (-) lead will be soldered to the switch.
lines.text_raw: Don't clip the leads yet! You can cut the (+) lead, but the (-) lead will be soldered to the switch.

lines.text: Attach the pre-tinned copper wires to the board.
lines.text_raw: Attach the pre-tinned copper wires to the board.

lines.text: You can see them at the top of this picture.
lines.text_raw: You can see them at the top of this picture.

lines.text: I used the 3rd hand to hold them in place while soldering.
lines.text_raw: I used the 3rd hand to hold them in place while soldering.

lines.text: The (2) 3cm wires go in the middle of the (2) 7cm wires.
lines.text_raw: The (2) 3cm wires go in the middle of the (2) 7cm wires.

lines.text: Solder the switch to the (-) side of the board and the twisted pair of wires from the capacitors.
lines.text_raw: Solder the switch to the (-) side of the board and the twisted pair of wires from the capacitors.

lines.text: Add the 12k resistor to the back of the board.
lines.text_raw: Add the 12k resistor to the back of the board.

lines.text: Make sure to read the included directions carefully and solder it in the right spot.
lines.text_raw: Make sure to read the included directions carefully and solder it in the right spot.

lines.text: One end goes to the (+) side of the capacitors and the other goes to a trace on the board.
lines.text_raw: One end goes to the (+) side of the capacitors and the other goes to a trace on the board.

lines.text: It can be a bit tricky to solder the speaker. I found using the 3rd hand to hold the speaker in place and bending the (2) 3cm wires was the easiest way to solder them together.
lines.text_raw: It can be a bit tricky to solder the speaker. I found using the 3rd hand to hold the speaker in place and bending the (2) 3cm wires was the easiest way to solder them together.

lines.text: Screw the switch into the cardboard template that you cut out.
lines.text_raw: Screw the switch into the cardboard template that you cut out.

lines.text: Next, feed the (2) 7cm leads through the holes in the template.
lines.text_raw: Next, feed the (2) 7cm leads through the holes in the template.

lines.text: Now solder the solar panel to the copper tinned leads.
lines.text_raw: Now solder the solar panel to the copper tinned leads.

lines.text: Make sure you orient the solar panel as described in the instructions.
lines.text_raw: Make sure you orient the solar panel as described in the instructions.

lines.text: The panel can be tricky to solder; make sure you use enough heat.
lines.text_raw: The panel can be tricky to solder; make sure you use enough heat.

lines.text: Push the whole assembly underneath the lip of the tin.
lines.text_raw: Push the whole assembly underneath the lip of the tin.

lines.text: The cardboard ring will hold it away from the bottom.
lines.text_raw: The cardboard ring will hold it away from the bottom.

lines.text: You might want to use a small screwdriver to slip the cardboard under the lip. It can be a bit tricky, but the template is a perfect fit.
lines.text_raw: You might want to use a small screwdriver to slip the cardboard under the lip. It can be a bit tricky, but the template is a perfect fit.

lines.text: That's it! Take it outside and make some music.
lines.text_raw: That's it! Take it outside and make some music.

lines.text: Make sure to watch my video demo too!
lines.text_raw: Make sure to watch my [http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=X_mv2rpal9s|video demo] too!
